utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm-hmm. There's no name, but according to the description she gave, he was in his mid-20s, medium build, wearing a blue blazer and an orange-striped tie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, I don't know about you guys, but I am getting a delicious millionaire playboy vibe here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The waitress was under the impression that he arrived with Olivia.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Olivia's best friend was a gal that she worked with. Maybe she could tell us who Olivia hung out with.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Perlmutter just finished reviewing Olivia's autopsy report from back in the day. He says he found something.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You guys take the morgue. I'll follow up on Olivia's friend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, sir.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I've gone through Ms. Debiasse's files and her autopsy was fairly limited. I assume when Brady confessed, the M.E. decided not to be thorough.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he miss something?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: It's hard to say.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does your gut tell you?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: My gut tells me I'm hungry, but I'm not gonna be able to eat until I'm done with the two of you. So why don't I just tell you what my keen M.E. training tells me? All right, Brady said he hit Olivia with a baseball bat. But look at these.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: When I look at these wounds and then skull fracture pattern, I'm just not seeing a baseball bat strike.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Brady lied about killing her, he might have lied about what was used to do it. Can you determine how she was killed?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: I'd only be speculating. To do it properly, I'd have to X-ray the skull and examine the remains.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You want to exhume the body?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: The only way to do it right. Plus, who knows what else I might find?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Olivia was raised by a single mom who's deceased as well, so let me call the next of kin and see what I can do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You sure it's sanitary to be eating here?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: You know the strength of the disinfectants we use here? This is the cleanest room in the city.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I couldn't.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Homemade.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I couldn't.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Caught a break. Captain talked to the friend.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does she remember who Olivia was with?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jeff Dilahunt, who's had his fair share of run-ins with the law. And he has a trust fund worth millions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Enough to pay $7,000 a month.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bingo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Boo-yah.

utterance.speaker: JEFF DILAHUNT
utterance.content: Uh, I met Olivia at a nightclub. She hadn't been in town long, but, uh, she seemed like a real party girl.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were the two of you dating?

utterance.speaker: JEFF DILAHUNT
utterance.content: Uh, no, just friends. What? Can't a guy and a girl just be friends?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Please.

utterance.speaker: JEFF DILAHUNT
utterance.content: Are you two together?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Absolutely not.

utterance.speaker: JEFF DILAHUNT
utterance.content: Look, it was, uh, no big deal. I happened to mention that a school friend of mine was having a family reunion here at the Pierson Club and asked me to stop by. Olivia really wanted to come, so I took her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who would want to go to someone else's family reunion?

utterance.speaker: JEFF DILAHUNT
utterance.content: Well, I suppose that all depends on the family. In this case, it happened to be the Wellesleys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The W-- "Wellesleys" Wellesleys? The rich and powerful Wellesleys? The conservative New York Wellesleys?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wasn't that one of our senators?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, he was. Senator Casper Wellesley. He died early '90s. His kid's running for his seat again this year.

utterance.speaker: JEFF DILAHUNT
utterance.content: Well, I'll tell you what. Next time I'm invited, I'll take you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Dilahunt, where were you between 10 p.m. and 2 a.m. the night that she was killed?

utterance.speaker: JEFF DILAHUNT
utterance.content: Okay, well, a couple of, uh, Wellesley cousins and I bailed early and went clubbing. I believe there may have been Bolivian Marching Powder involved. We got picked up for public intoxication. My father got the charges dropped, but, uh, there's still a record of our arrest. If you can't find it, I have a framed copy at home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you have an argument with Olivia that night? Or see anyone else who did?

utterance.speaker: JEFF DILAHUNT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A witness saw Olivia having it out with a man in a blue blazer and an orange-striped tie. Do you remember anyone who fit that description?

utterance.speaker: JEFF DILAHUNT
utterance.content: Actually, I do.

utterance.speaker: JEFF DILAHUNT
utterance.content: All Wellesley family events have a strict dress code. The, uh, blazers are standard, but Lenanne Wellesley, the family matriarch, handpicks the men's ties.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you thinking what I'm thinking?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yep. We got a hell of a lot of suspects.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Yes, Chief. No, I know, Chief. As soon as I possibly can, Chief.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: They cut our staff 20%, they get upset when our closure rate drops 3%. You ask me, we're working miracles to do what we're doing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Sir, we can do this later if you have a higher priority.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Never let the job get in the way of the job. Where were we?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, Brady and his contact communicated through a dummy e-mail account. We tried to trace the address, but it was a dead end.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Where are we with reviewing the guards?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nowhere. The warden refuses to provide us with a duty roster.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Said he was offended we assumed one of his men was dirty. He wanted to handle it in-house.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Yeah? Well, that doesn't work for me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do any of these men look like the one that you saw arguing with Olivia the night of the party?

utterance.speaker: EDWINA
utterance.content: Look, it was a stupid waitress job ten years ago. Do you remember what you were doing ten years ago?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you recall any details? Was he wearing glasses? Did he have a tattoo?

utterance.speaker: EDWINA
utterance.content: All I know is that the man was yelling at the girl. He got so riled up he spilled his wine, and I ended up cleaning it off the carpet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did he spill any on himself?

utterance.speaker: EDWINA
utterance.content: I don't know. Maybe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Trent Wellesley? I'm Detective Kate Beckett, NYPD. I need to have a word.

utterance.speaker: TRENT WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Yes. My old friend Jeff said I might be hearing from you.

utterance.speaker: LENANNE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Police? Are they the police?

utterance.speaker: TRENT WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Yes, Grandmother.

utterance.speaker: LENANNE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: My ring was stolen.

utterance.speaker: TRENT WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Oh, oh. Th-- they're not here for you, Grandmother.

utterance.speaker: LENANNE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: My ring was stolen. It's expensive.

utterance.speaker: FRANK DAVIS
utterance.content: Trent, perhaps you should take this conversation elsewhere.

utterance.speaker: TRENT WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Of course, Frank. She gets a little confused sometimes.

utterance.speaker: TRENT WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Okay, let's get this over with. It was me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was you? What?

utterance.speaker: TRENT WELLESLEY
utterance.content: I was the one who had the argument with the girl that Jeff brought to the reunion that night. The girl who was killed. I didn't care for her behavior, so I asked her to leave. Girls like that hang around families like mine for a reason. They want something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jeff brought her as his plus-one.

utterance.speaker: TRENT WELLESLEY
utterance.content: But he had left by then and she stayed. She tried to chat up more than one of my relatives.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anyone in particular?

utterance.speaker: TRENT WELLESLEY
utterance.content: You're barking up the wrong tree. No one in my family had anything to do with what happened to her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone paid almost a million dollars to cover up her murder. That makes everyone in your family a suspect, including you.

utterance.speaker: TRENT WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Trust me, if I had that kind of money to throw around, I wouldn't be here sucking up to the old lady.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice.

utterance.speaker: TRENT WELLESLEY
utterance.content: You think I'm rich because my last name's Wellesley, but my dad died when I was a kid. Mom and me had to pretty much survive off the handouts of relatives.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I suppose getting a job would be out of the question.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who are you protecting? You already admitted to arguing with her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It really does not look good.

utterance.speaker: TRENT WELLESLEY
utterance.content: You have to understand. He's like the only father I have.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who are you talking about, Trent?

utterance.speaker: TRENT WELLESLEY
utterance.content: My Uncle Winston. He'd just been through a bad breakup and... He's the kind of person that people try to take advantage of.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: People like who? Olivia? Or poor relations looking for a handout?

utterance.speaker: TRENT WELLESLEY
utterance.content: I'd seen her with him before.

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Yes, it's terrible what happened to that poor girl.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Could you tell us about the kind of relationship you had with her, Mr. Wellesley? Was the reunion the first time that you two met?

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Actually, I believe I met Olivia at a cocktail party a few weeks before that. Was it MoMA? I don't recall. Anyway, I took a shine to her. Charming. Ambitious. Rough around the edges, but I felt I could mentor her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And by mentor, you mean...

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: What are you suggesting?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your nephew Trent said that he saw her hitting on you the whole night.

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Well, that's Trent for you. He's always been very protective of the family.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you between 10 p.m. and 2 a.m. on the night she was murdered?

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Are you seriously asking me, Winston Wellesley, for an alibi? Oh. Apparently, you are. Fine. I was home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can anyone corroborate that?

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Yes. God.

utterance.speaker: BARTENDER
utterance.content: Mr. Wellesley, your car is ready.

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Mmm. As delightful as this conversation has been, I must take my leave. I have to meet my brother at his campaign headquarters.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, yes. Blake Wellesley, running for Senate again.

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. And we'd appreciate your support. Don't forget to vote.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have no doubt he was having an affair with Olivia. But why would he kill her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think maybe he was upset that she came with someone else?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm. Jealousy. Money. Murder. Does it get any better than this?

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: You want to exhume my niece's body?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We believe that there was evidence overlooked during the autopsy that could lead to her killer.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: Well, you told me you caught the man. You told me it was over.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I thought it was. But whoever killed Olivia just murdered two more people. Your niece deserves justice, and so do they.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: She was such a special girl. She quit school to take care of her mother when the cancer got bad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That says a lot about her.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: After her mother passed, it was like she had to get away. When she moved to the city I was just so happy for her. But then... You'll bury her back the way she was?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: At least she had the funeral she deserved. Thank God for Mr. Wellesley.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Wellesley?

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: The man who paid for everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which Mr. Wellesley was that?

utterance.speaker: SARA
utterance.content: Winston Wellesley.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Paid for her funeral? Can anyone say "guilty conscience"?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Hey, Esposito, run down Winston Wellesley's alibi. Talk to doormen, chauffeurs, the whole gamut.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I'll see what I can do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Prison duty roster. How'd you pull it off, sir?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: They didn't make me captain just because I look good behind a desk. Run all the guards on that roster. Look for anything out of the ordinary.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, I'm gonna call the cemetery to make arrangements to exhume the body tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You know what I don't get? Whoever is behind this, why'd he stop paying Brady? These Wellesleys have plenty of money. If the money hadn't stopped, Brady never would have set off this triggering domino that started all this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me let you in on a little secret. You know how rich people stay rich? They are cheap. Why pay for Brady for the rest of his life, when you can kill him for a fraction of the price?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But then why would he wait ten years?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Something changed. Something must have happened.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Captain Montgomery? Blake Wellesley. Hate to bother you, but do you have a minute to chat?

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: I speak for the entire Wellesley family when I say you can expect our full cooperation in this investigation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But? You can tell, there's a "but" coming.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Not a "but," a "however." Like I said, we'll cooperate; however, we request that these unannounced interviews come to a stop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here we go.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Beckett, let's hear him out.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: I apologize if I'm coming off like one of those guys, Detective. It's just that these impromptu visits are a bit awkward. My nephew Trent said you spoke to him when he visited my mother. Mother became very confused, very upset. I'm sure there's a better way to facilitate this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Well, I propose that all further interviews be coordinated by me and conducted at my offices. What do you think?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Thank you for your offer, Mr. Wellesley. It's very nice of you.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Not at all. I'll give you my number.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Hold on. I, too, have a "however." Thank you for your offer; however, my detectives will conduct their investigation in any manner they see fit.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Captain, I can get the commissioner on the phone in under a minute.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Well, tell him I said hi and I really could use a raise. I think we're done here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was awesome.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Whatever you guys are doing, keep doing it. They're circling the wagons.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Awesome!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ignore, accept, ignore... Accept, ignore...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, Mother, come on! Accept the man's friend request, already.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Using that old photo was a horrible idea. Why didn't you stop me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Since when have I had the power to stop you from doing anything?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What will Chet think if he expects 1980s Martha, and, pfft, present-day Martha shows up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You tell anyone I said this, and I'll deny it. And I'm only gonna say it once. 1980s Martha was pretty great, but present-day Martha is pretty spectacular, too.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Did you just accept that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, take it back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I'm sorry, I cannot.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, no. Come on...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But since it's done, why don't you take a visit to Chet's page, and see what he looks like nowadays?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Uh, just like this? Press that?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, good... Well, that's Chet, but how old is that photo?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Turnabout is fair play, Mother.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Chet Palaburn. What are you thinking, man?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: City workers brought the coffin in an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Winston didn't spare any pennies with this box of wood. This is the Bentley of caskets.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shopping ahead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Research. Derrick Storm, in Storm Warning, finds a murder weapon buried in a coffin a year before the murder occurs. Of course, who am I talking to? You know this.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Back in the non-fiction section, we have a real casket that's been sealed for ten years, so there's gonna be some serious decomposition. When I crack this open, expect the foulest of foul stenches.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Set?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Ready.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is the body missing or did you just pull of an awesome magic trick? You are amazing, sir.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Nope. No prints. Whoever removed Olivia's remains was careful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How do these people manage to stay one step ahead of us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Olivia's aunt said it was an open-casket funeral. So her body must have been in here at one point.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The mortuary company must have switched out the bodies between the funeral and the burial.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but the company's out of business, so there's no way of finding out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Winston had to have paid to get rid of the body, just in case Brady ever wanted to come clean with the police.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm-hmm. Looks like it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This guy's got contingency plans for his contingency plans. Feels like we're battling a super villain.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: Hey. Excuse me, dynamic duo.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: What am I doing with this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it depends. What can you get for a secondhand casket these days?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'll call Olivia's family and find out what they want to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously, though, I wonder what you could get for a slightly-used coffin. That thing is top of the line. Did you check the drawer?

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: What drawer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: High-end coffins often have a small drawer hidden somewhere in the lid. That way, families can place mementos in there, or psychotic killers can hide evidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nothing suspicious, it's just a bunch of family photographs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does that button say?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like a political button.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Edna Debiasse. Was Edna Debiasse Olivia's mother? Let me borrow your magnifying glass.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don't have a magnifying glass.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Isn't that standard issue for detectives?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Not since Sherlock Holmes.

utterance.speaker: PERLMUTTER
utterance.content: We can use mine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course. Mmm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: "Casper Wellesley, Senate '78."

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Olivia's mother worked on the campaign. All roads lead to Wellesley.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you looking at porn?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I use Ryan's computer for that. I've been searching a periodical database. Look what I found. In this article, it talks about how during his 1978 Senate run, Casper had his sons, Blake and Winston, heading up his campaign headquarters in Ithaca.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where Olivia's mom worked. She and Winston had to have crossed paths.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. Now why would Winston keep that from us?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We ran all the guards' names off that duty roster you got us from Brady's prison. He's the only one that red-flagged.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Name's Patterson. Made a deposit last month for $5,000 cash. Then the day Brady was killed, he makes another deposit in cash. This time for ten.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: If there's anything I hate, it's a dirtbag in uniform.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: So where you guys at with Winston Wellesley's alibi?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We have a few leads.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Keep pushing on that. I'll push on this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Wellesley, we are going to find out the truth. And the amount of dust that we kick up doing that is entirely up to you.

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: I do seem to recall making her acquaintance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You're telling us half-truths again. We already know that you paid for Olivia's funeral. We know that you knew her mom. Either you start telling me the truth, or you're gonna spend the last few weeks of your brother's campaign issuing denials after I release what I know to the press.

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Fine. I knew her mother. After her mother passed, Olivia set about to unravel the mystery of her origins. Olivia was clever. She put together the clues, found out her father was a Wellesley. A Wellesley.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Actually, truth is, I'm Olivia's father. I know. I had the same look on my face when Olivia told me ten years ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Olivia's mother didn't tell you?

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Mm-mmm. Didn't tell Olivia, either. I was just on the verge of telling everyone when she... She was tragically killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It is a tragedy when a father kills his daughter, isn't it?

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you know about Olivia's missing body?

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Nothing! That's obscene! Who would do something like that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You. So no one would ever find out the truth of who she really was.

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: I didn't kill her and I certainly didn't hide her body.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yet, ten years after her death, you're still trying to hide her existence.

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Well, you have to understand, I have a family to protect.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Olivia was family.

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Winston Wellesley, you did it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He might have, but we don't have the evidence to prove it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That's because he didn't. We were able to verify Winston's alibi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He really was home alone?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, he was home, but he wasn't alone. Winston had some romantic company that night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, then if he had an alibi, why didn't he just say so from the start?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe because of who his romantic company was.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Stanley Jenkins.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is Stanley a unisex name now, or is Winston...

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Gay? Uh, yeah, he's gay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He lied to us. Who is he protecting?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, he said it himself. Family.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: You have to understand that this young woman, Olivia, I hardly knew her. Maybe I shook her hand at the party, but that's all. And now you're telling me her mother and I worked at the same campaign 30 years ago?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You and your brother were in Ithaca July and August of '78. Olivia was born May '79. That's nine months later.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your brother claimed paternity, but I think we all know that's highly unlikely.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Winston, what the hell is going on here?

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Blake, it's time to get the lawyers involved.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: What did you know about this, Winston?

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: This is not the time or the place.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: I never saw Edna after that summer. She never told me anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, you admit to sleeping with her?

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: She must have not wanted to rock the boat, hurt my father's campaign with a scandal involving his son.

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Blake, you've said enough.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: I just found out I had a daughter I never knew about. A daughter who was murdered and whose killer apparently is still at large. Why did you tell the police you were her father? Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, the question is, why did he tell Olivia that ten years ago?

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: You have to understand, Blake, this was during the first Senate run. Scandal would have killed the campaign.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: I lost the damn election anyway. You had no right to make that decision without me!

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: We were only looking out for your best interests.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We? Winston, who is "we"?

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Mother, do you remember Olivia? Olivia Debiasse?

utterance.speaker: LENANNE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Of course I do. I have my mind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Wellesley, we need to a...

utterance.speaker: LENANNE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Who are you? Blake, that's not Olivia.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Yes, Mother. This is a police detective investigating...

utterance.speaker: LENANNE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Oh, yes. My ring was stolen. It was very expensive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, ma'am. Um, but before we can deal with that, we need to ask you a few questions about Olivia Debiasse.

utterance.speaker: LENANNE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Olivia. Came to me looking for a father, so I gave her Winston. A child would go a long way to butch up his image.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: But she was my daughter, Mother.

utterance.speaker: LENANNE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: You were too special. You're going to be a senator, maybe even President someday.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mrs. Wellesley, what happened to Olivia the night of her murder?

utterance.speaker: LENANNE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Ooh! So many questions about... I don't care for questions. Olivia questioned me. Ugh! The gall of that girl.

utterance.speaker: FRANK DAVIS
utterance.content: Mr. Wellesley, your mother is ill. She can't handle this...

utterance.speaker: LENANNE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Oh, shut it, Frank! I can handle anything.

utterance.speaker: FRANK DAVIS
utterance.content: It's dangerous for her to get this riled up. I'm getting her medication from the car.

utterance.speaker: LENANNE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: What does any of this have to do with my stolen ring?

utterance.speaker: WINSTON WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Mother, did you go to Olivia's apartment that night?

utterance.speaker: LENANNE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Well, she crossed me, had to be stopped.

utterance.speaker: BLAKE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: What did you do, Mother?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Wellesley, did you kill Olivia Debiasse?

utterance.speaker: LENANNE WELLESLEY
utterance.content: Kill her? Why would I kill her? No. I said, "Take care of it," and it was taken care of.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who did you ask to take care of it?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Well, well, well. If it isn't Frank Davis.

utterance.speaker: FRANK DAVIS
utterance.content: Sorry, pal. Got the wrong guy.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: I don't think so, pal. I just spent the better part of the day sweating a guard named Patterson who works in the prison where Brady Thompson was killed.

utterance.speaker: FRANK DAVIS
utterance.content: I don't know any Brady Thompson and I don't know any Patterson.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: That's funny, 'cause he knows you. Said that you paid him to monitor Brady Thompson's calls about a package.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. No, no, no.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Said that you paid him to have a lifer put a shiv in Brady Thompson's back. Now you tell me how I got the wrong guy.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Cuffs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, Frank was the family hitman?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: More like the family fixer. He cleaned up all types of dirt for Senator Wellesley back in the day. He knows where all the bodies are buried.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And which ones need to be dug up.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: And then after he got rid of Olivia on Mrs. Wellesley's orders, he called around to all his low-life connections until he found someone desperate enough to cut a deal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why, after ten years, would he suddenly stop paying Brady to do his jail time?

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: When Mrs. Wellesley lost her faculties, Blake was granted power of attorney.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Frank couldn't get the money to make the payments anymore.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he stopped, figuring Brady would just disappear.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: And when he found out Brady had evidence to prove his innocence, Frank panicked. He stole Mrs. Wellesley's ring and hocked it to finance his plan to shut Brady up permanently.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By the way, I took a look at the precinct's numbers. Three closed cases puts us just over the mandated case closure rate. Right in time for the review tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You know what's even better than that? After ten years, I can call Olivia's aunt and tell her that we really got the guy. Finally.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you get to give the messenger's sister some closure, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Though I don't suppose having answers makes it any easier.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It does. In time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I can't believe how many lives were ruined over one woman's need to protect her family's reputation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You will never have this problem. Between Grams and myself, our family reputation's already in ruins.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mmm. Lucky me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What's gonna happen to Brady's son?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, there's a silver lining there. When Blake Wellesley found out why Brady sold his freedom...

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ...he pledged 20 million dollars to a local kids' charity who agreed to handle Brady's son's care.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, that's so sweet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And... Wow.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Looking good, Grams. Hot date?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Dining and dancing with Chet Palaburn.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if he turns out to be bloated and ugly?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh. How superficial do you think I am?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Intensely. Mother, what is going on?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Present-day Martha is going on. I've had filthy, stinking rich. I've had broke, dirt poor. And you know what I want now? Fun. Just fun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And if you aren't what Chet's expecting?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, please, darling. Look at me. Come on.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It doesn't get any better than that. Don't wait up for me, kids. Mama's on the prowl.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, that poor bastard.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Is insanity inherited?
